name: Classic Spaghetti Bolognese
ingredients: 400ml/14fl oz stock (made from stock cube. Ideally beef, but any will do)
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot or deep skillet over medium high heat. Add onion and garlic, cook for 3 minutes or until light golden and softened.
Turn heat up to high and add beef. Cook, breaking it up as your go, until browned.
Add red wine. Bring to simmer and cook for 1 minute, scraping the bottom of the pot, until the alcohol smell is gone.
Taste and add more salt it desired. Serve over spaghetti – though if you have the time, I recommend tossing the sauce and pasta per steps below.
Divide between bowls. Garnish with parmesan and parsley if desired.

name: Chicken Curry
ingredients: ½ teaspoon grated fresh ginger root
2 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into bite-size pieces
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Sauté onion until lightly browned.
Stir in garlic, curry powder, cinnamon, paprika, bay leaf, ginger, sugar, and salt. Continue stirring for 2 minutes.
Add chicken pieces, tomato paste, yogurt, and coconut milk. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes.
Remove bay leaf, and stir in lemon juice and cayenne pepper. Simmer 5 more minutes.

name: Caprese Salad
ingredients: 220 g/7oz bocconcini / baby or cherry mozzarella
500 g / 1 lb cherry or grape tomatoes
instructions: Place Dressing ingredients in a jar and shake very well. Adjust to taste.
Place tomatoes, bocconcini and most of the basil in a bowl. Drizzle over dressing, toss gently.
Transfer to shallow serving bowl. Just before serving, drizzle with balsamic glaze and sprinkle with remaining basil.

name: Beef Stir-Fry
instructions: Place Dressing ingredients in a jar and shake very well. Adjust to taste.
Heat vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over medium-high heat; cook and stir beef until browned, 3 to 4 minutes.
Place tomatoes, bocconcini and most of the basil in a bowl. Drizzle over dressing, toss gently.
Transfer to shallow serving bowl. Just before serving, drizzle with balsamic glaze and sprinkle with remaining basil.
